page.title: 16Parks in Rayleigh
page.content:
{Fairview}has been a park for 60 years. It was once Fairview House,garden and orchard.The perimeter is 968m.We saw 6 tennis courts,4 tarmac and 2 grass. Cricketers and footballers use the pavilion,and during the week an under 5 playgroup use it.There were swings and a giant back-bend climbing frame in the children's playground.
{King George's Field}is in the town and it has a big children's play area with swings,slides,roundabout and tunnels.
{Brooklands}is like a large garden and has been a park for about 6 years.We walked 400 paces around the park and 115 paces around the pond.We saw 4 sticklebacks and 7 water-lilies. The fir tree was the tallest tree. It started to rain and thunder so we hurried back to our school.
